sen.j: 明保野亭事件（あけぼのていじけん）は、幕末の京都において発生した、長州系浪士捕縛活動においての誤報に起因する土佐藩士傷害・切腹と、それに伴う会津藩士自刃事件である。
sen.e: Akebonotei Jiken, which occurred in Kyoto at the end of Edo period, was an incident of wounding and forcing a retainer of Tosa domain along with committing suicide of a retainer of Aizu domain with his sword, resulted from wrong information in an operation of arresting lordless samurai of Choshu domain.

Akebonotei Jiken, which occurred in Kyoto at the end of the Edo period, was an incident where a retainer of the Tosa domain was wounded and committed suicide, together with a retainer of the Aizu domain who also committed suicide with his own sword, which resulted from mis-information during an operation to arrest masterless samurai from the Choshu domain.

sen.j: 1864年6月10日 (旧暦)（1864年7月13日）に、幕府の命により池田屋事件の残党の捕縛を命じられた新選組が、同日に東山区の料亭・明保野（あけぼの、曙とも）に長州系浪士が潜伏するとの情報を得た。
sen.e: On July 13, 1864, Shinsengumi received an order from the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) to arrest the remnants of those at the Ikedaya Incident, and on the same day, Shinsengumi got information that lordless samurai of Choshu domain were hidden in the restaurant Akebono (which was written 明保野, あけぼの, or 曙) in Higashiyama Ward.

sen.cmt: 新撰組の説明補足あけぼの→削除domain→clan

sen.j: 武田観柳斎率いる新選組隊士15名と、前日より応援として派遣されていた会津藩士20名のうち5名が共に捕縛に向かった。
sen.e: Fifteen members of Shinsengumi led by Kanryusai TAKEDA and five out of twenty retainers of Aizu domain who had been dispatched the day before for supporting Shinsengumi went to arrest the lordless samurai.

sen.cmt: domain→clan数字が文の最初に来ているので、スペルアウトし、他の数字も統一しました。

sen.j: 現場で会津藩家中の柴司が、座敷にいた武士を制止しようとしたところ相手が逃げ出したため、取り押えようと追跡のうえ槍で傷を負わせた。
sen.e: At the scene, when Tsukasa SHIBA, a retainer of Aizu domain, tried to control samurai in a guest room, the samurai escaped there, which prompted SHIBA to pursue and wound the samurai with the spear in an effort to catch the samurai.

sen.j: 直後に相手が浪士ではなく土佐藩士麻田時太郎（時次郎、とする説もある）と判明したため、その場で解放した。
sen.e: Soon after, the samurai was found Tokitaro ASADA (Tokijiro, in another opinion), a retainer of Tosa domain, and not the lordless samurai.
Soon after, the samurai was found to be Tokitaro ASADA (Tokijiro, in another opinion), a retainer of Tosa domain, and not a masterless samurai.

sen.j: 当初、柴の行為に問題無しとして念のため会津藩から医師と謝罪の使者を送り、これに対し土佐藩側も最初に名乗らなかった麻田にも落ち度があると理解を示していた。
sen.e: At first, SHIBA's action was passed and the Aizu clan dispatch a doctor and a messenger of apologee to Tosa clan, and the Tosa clan responded that by mentioning that ASADA was also blamed for not giving his name at the beginning.

sen.j: しかし、翌6月11日 (旧暦)に麻田が「士道不覚悟」として藩により切腹させられたことにより、若い土佐藩士たちが「片手落ち」だと激昂し、会津・土佐の関係に亀裂が入りかねない事態へと発展した。
sen.e: On June 11 (old calendar), however, ASADA was forced to commit Seppuku by the Tosa clan for Shido-fukakugo (disobeying Bushido (the code of the samurai)), which infuriated young retainers of Tosa clan who clamored that the punishment was too "unfair" loudly enough to harm the relationship between the Aizu clan and the Tosa clan.

sen.j: 結局6月12日 (旧暦)に柴司が謝罪の意で切腹し、両者の関係悪化は回避された。
sen.e: At last on June 12 (old calendar), Tsukasa SHIBA committed Seppuku for expressing apologee, preventing the relationship between the Aizu clan and the Tosa clan from damaged.

sen.j: 当時、土佐藩は藩主山内容堂のもと公武合体を支持しており、会津藩との関係も良好であったが、内部には土佐勤王党など倒幕を目論む勢力もあり、その中で起きた傷害事件はまさに両藩の関係に水を差すものであった。
sen.e: In those days, under the rule of the lord Yodo YAMAUCHI, the Tosa clan supported kobu-gattai (integration of the imperial court and the shogunate) and kept good relationship with the Aizu clan, but also had such power as Tosa kinnoto (loyalist clique of Tosa) which aimed to overthrow the bakufu; therefore, in that circumstances, the injury incident cast a shadow over the relationship between the two clans.

sen.j: 柴司は自らの職務を遂行したのみであったが、自ら犠牲となる事で両者の関係悪化を食い止めた。

sen.j: この事件の舞台となった明保野亭は当時、他にも多く見られた様に料亭と旅宿を兼ねており、倒幕の志士による密議にも多く利用されていたことが事件の背景にあったと考えられる。
sen.e: Akebonotei where the incident took place was served as both restaurant and hotel like other restaurants did in those days was also frequently used by the royalists who aimed at overthrowing the bakufu in their closed session, which was in the context of the incident.
